required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impacts of the Different Anesthesia Methods on Patients of Transbronchial Cryobiopsy
clinical_study.official_title: The Impacts of the Different Anesthesia Methods on Patients of Transbronchial Cryobiopsy:A Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: to evaluate the difference between the tracheal intubation (TI) and rigid bronchoscopy (RB) under general anesthesia on patients with transbronchial cryobiopsy.

detailed_description.textblock: To evaluate the difference between the tracheal intubation (TI) and rigid bronchoscopy (RB) under general anesthesia on patients with transbronchial cryobiopsy. Comparing the difference between two groups in the operating duration, extubation duration, total anesthesia time, heart rate, blood pressure and arterial blood gas analysis. This is a prospective, randomized, controlled trial.

primary_outcome.description: fluctuation of heart rate during the procedure
the fluctuation of blood pressure during the procedure

primary_outcome.measure: the fluctuation of arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide
primary_outcome.description: the fluctuation of arterial partial pressure of carbon dioxide during the procedure

arm_group.description: patient was insert trachial intubation with normal frequency jet ventilation
patient was insert trachial intubation with high frequency jet ventilation

intervention.description: patient was insert trachial intubation or rigid bronchoscopy with ventilation under general anesthesia
intervention.other_name: insert rigid bronchoscopy under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The patients are admitted in the institution as ILD, while undefined after thorough history collection, laboratory examination and radiological data.
2. Transbronchial cryobiopsy(TBCB) is indicated by clinicians for definitive diagnosis and patients are content with the examination with agreement signed.
3. Blood gas analysis, routine blood test, ECG examination, coagulation function, immunological examination, chest HRCT, and liver/kidney function test have been completed
Exclusion Criteria:
1. The radiological data indicates non-ILD
2. The clinical examinations mentioned above are not completed.
3. The patient cannot endure or does not agree the procedure.

facility.name: The first affilliated hospital of Guanghzhou Medical university
